original: Ekedahl, David, apotekare, Halmstad, f. 28/11/78 i Femsjö, Jönköp. 1., av kontraktsprosten G. W. E. o. Susen Sjöblom. G. 16 m. Astrid Petri. Barn: Elsa, leg. apot., g. m. apot. P.-L. Rootzén, Greta, fil. kand., g. m. bankkamr. S. Andersson, Karin, sjuksköt., Ann-Mari, anst. v. statens bakt. lab., Ingrid. — Farm. kand. 98, apot:-ex. 05. Elev v. apot. Hjorten i Lund 94-97, anst. v. apot. Hjorten i Östersund 98-00, i Vara, v. Lejonet i Eskilstuna 0il-03, i Ulricehamn o. Södertälje, v. Kärnan i Hälsingborg 07-14, v. Lejonet i Växjö 14-19, v. Kronan i Linköp. 19-26, priv. å apot. i Tings-ryd 26, dito å apot. Vakteln i Halmstad, pens. 46, äg. kemik :hand. Kronan i Halmstad. FuHm. i Sv. farm:förb. •o. ordf. i deS’S sydöstra krets 17-20, v. ordf. i dess östgötakrets 20-26, fullm. 21-24, led. av centr:styr. 24-26, dess v. ordf. 25-26, styr :led. i sydöstra krets, av Sv. apot :förb. fr. 28, fullm. i Apot:kårens livr:- o. pens:- kassa fr. 30, led. av direkt, f. Apot:societeten 32-36, led. av komm :fullm. i Tingsryd 30, fd. ordf. i styr. f. Tingsryds lärl:sk. o. föreläsn :fören. Medl. av Rotarykl.
translated: Ekedahl, David, pharmacist, Halmstad, born November 28, 1878 in Femsjö, Jönköping County, first child of the vicar G. W. E. and Susen Sjöblom. Married since 1916 to Astrid Petri, they have five children: Elsa, a licensed pharmacist, married to pharmacist P.-L. Rootzén; Greta, Bachelor of Arts, married to bank clerk S. Andersson; Karin, a nurse; Ann-Mari, employed by the State Bakery Laboratory; and Ingrid. Graduated in pharmaceuticals in 1898 and passed the pharmacist's examination in 1905. Worked as an apprentice at Hjorten Pharmacy in Lund from 1894-1897, and at Hjorten Pharmacy in Östersund from 1898-1900, and since then at various other pharmacies throughout Sweden until his retirement in 1946, when he became the owner of the Kronan Chemical Store in Halmstad. He was involved in the Swedish Pharmaceutical Association as a member from 1928, served as deputy chairman of the Southeast District from 1920-1926, was a board member from 1924-1926, served as vice chairman in 1925-1926, and served on the board of the Southeast District. He was a member of the Swedish Apothecary Association, full member and pension fund member from 1930, a member of the board of directors of the Apothecary Society from 1932-1936, a member of the municipal council in Tingsryd from 1930, former chairman of the board of the Tingsryd Apprentice School and a member of the Lecture Association. He was also a member of the Rotary Club.
